author: rmccampbell
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

When PSNativeCommandArgumentPassing is enabled and $PSNativeCommandArgumentPassing = "Windows", empty arguments don't work with native commands. I copied the exact example shown in the [PS docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/learn/experimental-features?view=powershell-7.2#psnativecommandargumentpassing), along with the TestExe.exe sample program compiled from the [source](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/test/tools/TestExe/TestExe.cs), but with the feature variable set to "Windows":
```
> $PSNativeCommandArgumentPassing = "Windows"
> .\TestExe.exe -echoargs '' a b ''
Arg 0 is <a>
Arg 1 is <b>
```
"Standard" mode works just fine and according to the example. According to the [docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/learn/experimental-features?view=powershell-7.2#psnativecommandargumentpassing), I would expect the "Standard" and "Windows" modes to be the same other than the special cases mentioned.

### Expected behavior

```console
> $PSNativeCommandArgumentPassing = "Windows"
> .\TestExe.exe -echoargs '' a b ''
Arg 0 is <>
Arg 1 is <a>
Arg 2 is <b>
Arg 3 is <>
```


### Actual behavior

```console
> $PSNativeCommandArgumentPassing = "Windows"
> .\TestExe.exe -echoargs '' a b ''
Arg 0 is <a>
Arg 1 is <b>
```


### Error details

_No response_

### Environment data

```powershell
PSVersion                      7.2.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.2.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19044
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


### Visuals

_No response_

comments.author: kasini3000

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
The expected result probably should be the following (got it from running in CMD)
```
C:\>C:\arena\repos\PowerShell\test\tools\TestExe\bin\Debug\net7.0\win-x64\publish\testexe.exe -echoargs '' a b ''
Arg 0 is <''>
Arg 1 is <a>
Arg 2 is <b>
Arg 3 is <''>

C:\>
```

comments.author: rmccampbell
comments.body:
@daxian-dbw The intention is to pass the *contents* of the arguments verbatim to the program, not the raw powershell syntax. Powershell interprets the empty quotes as empty strings. When passed to the underlying program they should be passed as double quotes so the C runtime interprets them as empty strings. This is how the "Standard" mode works.
Edit: try replacing '' with "" in your CMD call and it should give the expected result

title: $PSNativeCommandArgumentPassing = "Windows" doesn't work with empty args
